Detailed Description

template<template< template< size_t > class ValueType > class MemoryCell, template< size_t > class ValueType>
class SemanticStateX86< MemoryCell, ValueType >

State of a semantic analysis.

Binary semantic analysis usually progresses one instruction at a time--one starts with an initial state and the act of processing an instruction modifies the state. The SemanticStateX86 is the base class class for the semantic states of various instruction semantic policies. It contains storage for all the machine registers and a vector of MemoryCell objects to represent memory.

Definition at line 122 of file SemanticState.h.

Member Function Documentation

template<template< template< size_t > class ValueType > class MemoryCell, template< size_t > class ValueType>
void SemanticStateX86< MemoryCell, ValueType >::clear (  )  [inline]

Initialize state.

The state is initialized using the ValueType default constructor and the memory vector is emptied.

Definition at line 137 of file SemanticState.h.

template<template< template< size_t > class ValueType > class MemoryCell, template< size_t > class ValueType>
void SemanticStateX86< MemoryCell, ValueType >::zero_registers (  )  [inline]

Initialize all registers to zero.

This is done with the ValueType((uint64_t)0) constructor. Memory is not affected.

Definition at line 149 of file SemanticState.h.

void SemanticStateX86< MemoryCell, ValueType >::clear_memory (  )  [inline]

Clear all memory locations.

This just empties the memory vector.

Definition at line 161 of file SemanticState.h.

template<template< template< size_t > class ValueType > class MemoryCell, template< size_t > class ValueType>
template<typename PrintHelper>
void SemanticStateX86< MemoryCell, ValueType >::print_registers ( std::ostream &  o,
const std::string  prefix = "",
PrintHelper *  ph = NULL 
) const [inline]

Print the register contents.

This emits one line per register and contains the register name and its value. The ph argument is a templatized PrintHelper that is simply passed as the second argument of the underlying print methods for the ValueType.

Definition at line 169 of file SemanticState.h.

template<template< template< size_t > class ValueType > class MemoryCell, template< size_t > class ValueType>
template<typename PrintHelper>
void SemanticStateX86< MemoryCell, ValueType >::print_memory ( std::ostream &  o,
const std::string  prefix = "",
PrintHelper *  ph = NULL 
) const [inline]

Print memory contents.

This simply calls the MemoryCell::print method for each memory cell. The ph argument is a templatized PrintHelper that's just passed as the second argument to the underlying print methods for the ValueType.

Definition at line 200 of file SemanticState.h.

template<template< template< size_t > class ValueType > class MemoryCell, template< size_t > class ValueType>
template<typename PrintHelper>
void SemanticStateX86< MemoryCell, ValueType >::print ( std::ostream &  o,
const std::string  prefix = "",
PrintHelper *  ph = NULL 
) const [inline]

Print the state.

This emits a multi-line string containing the registers and all known memory locations. The ph argument is a templatized PrintHelper pointer that's simply passed as the second argument to the print methods for the ValueType.

Prints a semantic policy state.

This is the same as calling the SemanticStateX86's print() method with an empty prefix string and a null PrintHelper.
